name: The Westin Bayshore, Vancouver

reviews.text: I stayed here in July last year. This hotel was a 5min cab ride from the centre of the action, but it had a very peaceful vibe. Felt like I was in Japan. The suite was very nice, and had a view of the mountains.
reviews.title: Nice view of the mountains

reviews.text: There is a nice restaurant next door on the pier.
reviews.title: Gorgeous view of Stanley Park!

reviews.text: I would stay here again with my partner, not solo. As it tended to be a bit quiet.
reviews.title: Great waterfront location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Bayshore a few times for conferences and the location is perfect. Not in the actual heart of downtown, just off to the edge with Stanley Park a quick walk away but also just a short walk to the heart of the city. It's peaceful there but when you want the hustle of the city you can be there in minutes. Oh, and a Starbucks in the building is a huge plus!
reviews.title: Almost Perfect

reviews.text: As a client using the facilites just for one night I left wanting much more. The room was of an excellent standard but the 'piece de resistance' was the window which opened the full length of the room to enable superb views across the bay and a splendid sight of the planes landing and taking off from the waterfront. The meal in the restaurant was very good and the staff extremely courteous and helpful. The Westin prides itself on its signature beds and it really was a case of 'head on pillow and fast alseep immediately'. If I could import one of their beds I would!
reviews.title: 4 Diamond Property? Hardly.

reviews.text: I stayed here for a few nights for business, but my family came along to enjoy the amenities of a fancy hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful scenery/view!

reviews.text: Good: The view from the hotel is amazing, I had a stunning of the water side and part of the city. The beds are amazingly comfortable. Tonnes of drawer space. The little soaps/shampoos they have in the washroom are spa smelling (very nice). The kids enjoyed the swimming pool (nothing special about it). Very handy to have a starbucks downstairs too.
reviews.title: Westin Bayshore - Vancouver

reviews.text: Bad: There is very little street parking around here (pay a fortune paying meter parking), have to pay for their underground parking which is across the street from the hotel. Not very enjoyable if we have to roll our luggage across the way in the rain (able to leave the luggage at front of hotel and drive back and pick it up, but time consuming). If you don't eat within the fancy expensive hotel and want to eat elsewhere, you would have to walk or drive a few blocks. If you drive you, you would have to pay for any parking downtown. If you want to go to Robson or trendy area, it's a further walk away.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in Downtown Vancouver

reviews.text: All good at the Westin, rooms large, clean and well appointed. Maid service good.
reviews.title: Great location and beautiful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - Location - if you want the best of both worlds, on the marina, close to Stanley, yet a short stroll to the convention centre then this is it!
reviews.title: A Waste of Money / Worst Experience At 4 Star Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at The Westin Bayshore hotel from April 7-11th for a business conference. The hotel room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The views from the tower rooms are INCREDIBLE & GORGEOUS. The bed and pillows were super comfortable. Housekeeping was nice, nothing overly amazing. I found that the bar wine list for wine by the glass was lacking and what was listed was overpriced (I found wines in Vancouver overprices in general). Also their prices for breakfast or room service was pricey as well. Conference rooms were a little too cold (cold, not cool), they may want to relax on the A/C
reviews.title: Great Hotel for personal or conferences!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definietly stay in this hotel again, for a conference or for a vacation :)
reviews.title: View is priceless!!! fantastic location

reviews.text: Reception somewhat disoriented. We booked two rooms - got reservation all mixed up. Charged us for something we never consumed, promised to change and never did! rooms spacious. Housekeeping mediocre.
reviews.title: Great Location - Friendly Staff!

reviews.text: Room with the harbor view was great! The beds were comfortable the location was close to hike and bike trails - great cafes across the street for early morning risers. The front desk staff - were amazing and friendly. My "Sisters Trip" was at this location was safe and relaxing.
reviews.title: Friendly, Clean Centrally located

reviews.text: From the reservationist, to the valet to the front desk. Everyone seemed geniune and enjoyed their job and sevices they offered. I took 3 teen age girls who got to know everyone on a "first name basis." It was pretty magical to see the transformation of employees when these girls continuously used everyones name over and over and over. I think we get so busy that we forget to acknowedge people anymore. Give it a try, it sets a great tone for the stay.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel

reviews.text: Service amazing. Perfect location right next to Stanley Park. Walk to downtown. Lots of resturants within walkiing distant. Beautiful walk along the waterfront (bring roller skates or rent bikes) Make sure to bring shoes good for walking uphills. Salmon charters and boat crusies at your door step.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Bayshore hotel is one of the best hotels I have had the experience of staying in in Canada. The room we had was large and very well appointed (including very comfortable beds - a plus after 18 hours travelling) with a wonderful view looking out onto the water - Coal Harbour -where one could see the seaplanes taking off for various destinations around BC. The hotel staff were pleasant and very helpful. The hotel is well located with respect to central Vancouver and it is a very short walk to Stanley Park which was in full bloom during our stay in June. The breakfasts at the hotel were excellent and kept us going for the whole day. We found a very good deal via the web for around 150 Canadian dollars/night, which given the quality of the hotel, was a bargain.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I both live in Vancouver, but we stayed at the Westin Bayshore for a staycation long weekend when we both needed a break but didn't have the time or money to go too far away. We got a good price through priceline, though it wasn't as cheap as I expected for a weekend in the middle of January. The views are beautiful, and several shops, restaurants and tourist attractions are a short walk away (but not so close that you're right in the middle of the hustle and bustle.) The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are clean and modern, and their bath products are excellent. The front desk staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. The indoor pool is quite good though the hot tub/whirlpool wasn't that hot when I was there. There is a large outdoor pool that looks like it would be a great place to go during summer.
reviews.title: Great place for a staycation
Great stay. Awesome views
reviews.text: The Bayshore has to be one of my new favourite places to stay in YVR. It's close proximity to shopping and restaurants make its a great place for someone who wants to explore the downtown core on foot. The staff was very helpful, and despite a power outage, did everything to make my stay comfortable. I wish more hotels would make it easier to charge electronics though.
If your looking for a great waterfront location, this is it.
reviews.title: close to everything

aka: The Westin Bayshore, Vancouver Hotel Vancouver
description: Enjoy views of the coastline, distant mountains, and Stanley Park. Connected to the historic 1,000-acre Stanley Park via its picturesque seawall, you're just moments away from unspoiled nature.
